column3: Chassis built up and wired up, including RIG board, waiting for rest of circuit boards to be made.
Installed NEW circuit boards, MET, Serial, and CPU board.
Installed new firware version 1.12, 130306.  All data inputs tested okay.  RF modem tested okay. Formated new 2GB Flash Ram Card.
Started current drain test with all sensors in Doghouse outside
Stopped current drain test.  Ave current = 16.17mA.  Had two 6 hour Iridium buffers missing, that did not transmit.
Removed solder bridge shorting of JP24 on back of CPU board.  This removes the battery power inputs to A/D circuit on J12 from powering the CPU board.
Started Lake test in Buoy, testing firmware version 1.12, 140211, full MET sensor suite, plus 5 subsurface sensors: SSTC, TC, Aquadopp, T, and TP.
Connected Monitoring computer to capture test date in a log file
Rain Gauge Failed on TEST buoy in boat basin?  Std Dev of Rain Rate went from near zero to 100-200 counts.
Swapped Failed Rain 764 with NEW replacement Rain 1642 on TEST buoy in Boat Basin
Successfully updated cal file with Rain 1642 via Iridium command
2nd Rain gauge, sn1642 failed on TFLEX0012 TEST, data reading 1E+35.
Swapped Rain gauge (3rd one) Installed sn 1262, swapped out 1642 where data read 1E+35 continuously.
Rain gauges, 674 & 1642 both bench tested okay (post-swap), so the failure must be with the Rain channel on the TFLEX circuit board (MET board?)
ENDED Buoy test in boat basin, XMIT battery voltage low, no more Iridium call ins.
FAILED on IO1-15a, NO COMS.  I had case sitting on deck during IO1 cruise, it might have rolled and knocked something off circuit board???

Swapped in NEW CPU board (OLD CPU BOARD draws high current, around 27mA).  This fixed coms, but current drain still high, reading 38mA, instead of 8-12mA, terminal mode, quiesent current.  Needs further testing.

Ryan wells fixed this system while I was on cruise travel for IO5-16(Jan 2017).  His comment tag says that he swapped the CPU and MET boards.  He also did a current drain test, resulting in 15.8mA average.
Changed the Rain shield ground wiring from seawater ground to Pin 1 power ground.  Also cut off the power jumper between the wind and compass connectors on the connector board (since its not needed).
Back from sea, Rec IO2-18-RB.  Deployed for one year on RT-016, 8S-67E.  This system had 3 resets during its deployment?
Installed metal SS standoffs on bottom of circuit board stack.
Upgraded to v2.01, 170530 firmware.
Changed Iridium 1st transmit time to 00:45. (note: can't use 00:35)
Ran benchtop current drain test for 5 days, 14.7mA average.  Flash RAM data dump okay.
Successfully tested XMIT and GPS commands outside on internal antennas.
Found the black dummy bulkhead on the faceplate loose.  Replaced it with a new one.
Installed NEW O-rings, both Jam seal and face seal.
